text: I just came across a really cool paper <https://00248909357804553642.googlegroups.com/attach/457d4f2e58e27/MinefieldMethod-IEEE.pdf?part=0.1.1&view=1&view=1&vt=ANaJVrGj3Y_ty4g3uhpv75Mbs98kXh6t5NbZmHSxvQyRqmmiRAMuLqExLg9aqJrLEOdVQ2DtCE7Cl5nxfXUKnJaMeFAyO5b_2I35Gxira9lVrQIrOaq2hDA|Minefield Method>. It provides a really interesting idea for getting correctly rounded functions. Basically, instead of trying to get uniformly high accuracy, you first find all the points where high precision is needed and focus on threading the gaps to get the correct rounding for those points.
